Comment: I don't really care about repeating the Biden administration where we get nothing done and just hand over power to Republicans again in another 2 to 4 years.    Yeah maybe prtizker could beat vance or whoever. But how do you win big enough to actually get some things done this time?    Democrats did it in 06 and 08 by pinning the Iraq war and a recession on Republicans. To do that again it seems you'll need a recession and probably oligarchy as the two best issues for Democrats. Musk proved to be a huge liability for Republicans in Wisconsin.    The only reason Democrats would nominate a billionaire after that election is if they don't really want to win big because then their own members would have to be the ones blocking the reforms they pretend to support    Appears that dude blocked me, here is my response to his below post:   >The CHIPS act which brings actual manufacturing jobs back to America.   If voters wanted tax cuts for global corporations they can just elect Republicans   > The first infrastructure bill in 60 years.   Adjusted for inflation Obama's infrastructure bill was similar in size. I don't get the obvious lie here go inflate bidens accomplishments? If passing infrastructure was such an effective way to win elections it sure doesn't show up in the data   >Capping insulin   The US still has ever widening price gaps between our drugs and other countries. The gap isn't getting smaller but bigger. If during an inflationary crises Biden can't even majorly shrink that gap he obviously didn't actually care about lowering inflation    >Expanded overtime guarantees. Put a stop to discramnatory mortgage lending. Crackdown on junk and overdraft fees.    Some of that never went even went into effect   The best thing Biden did was the expanded child tax credit. But then the establishment called it "moderate" to get rid of that effectively creating the largest tax increase ever on Americans with children.    Where was the public option, the paid maternity leave, the increased minimum wage?  Anytime somebody leads off instead with tax cuts for global corporations you know it's gonna be a rough convo
